author: Chris Patten-Walker
title: Cardano Mobile App
description: Members need a structured format to easily on board to the Project Catalyst project in a format they are familar with.

assessments.note:
not clear what and why is the "format they are familar with.". Challenge is not well defined or addressed.
There are a few ongoing efforts to help the whole "Cardano users", should be addressed and differentiate.

The proposal presented addresses the challenge, but there are not enough details about how the project will propose value onboarding. The Catalyst project has numerous aspects and complexity, when it comes to value onboarding it is necessary to think about the different parties involved (voters, proposer and community advisors) and how the onboard will be carried out efficiently. I recommend that the planning be more detailed and that the proposers participate in the discussions in the Catalyst group on Discord, as discussions on value onboarding are already taking place there.

This proposal focuses on lowering the friction of the on-boarding process for catalyst community members. Catalyst will potentially see the impact in 6 months, well beyond the 2 fund timeline that this challenge seeks to achieve improvements in.

The proposer aims to create an app where individuals will be able to learn and collaborate in order to implement their ideas on project Catalyst. The proposer seeks to create a more direct path to being a Community Advisor or Proposer. The proposer also plans on implementing Catalyst tokens are rewards for participation.

This is a fine proposal with a large user base potential. It would benefit the community greatly in regards to sustain a structured overview.
It could be improved by emphasising the problem it solves.

This is a great idea and quite helpful to be used for the purposes of connecting different platforms and be a one stop shop for Cardano. The project can always add more applications and utility adaptions for Dapps and Defi use.

The proposers described experiences / skills that confirm their technical capabilities for the development of the application, but the value onboarding challenge requires an understanding of Catalyst and its particularities and the team has not shown to be actively involved in a significant way in the Catalyst discussions related to value onboarding . For dapp to be relevant to users, the team needs to understand the needs / priorities of value onboarding and this requires time.

The proposer appears to have relevant experience as well as working in a team which increases their chances of success. However, they are seeking to develop something that would conflict with Ideascale itself, which would split the community instead of organizing it. Perhaps seeking collaboration with Ideascale will provide better results for all parties involved.
linked in profile is lazy thing to do, passing to the reviewer to realize what's relevant and what not. it could have been a nice addition to what they think is relevant.
Highly likely to get implemented successfully. A clear plan has been set. The team has relevant experience.
Given the metrics and the experience presented in the proposal as well as the detailed plan in place to execute the solution is highly likely this will be implemented successfully.

The proposal provided details on budget allocation, a detailed roadmap, milestones and reasonable KPIs.

However, the creation of a dapp with tokens alone will not solve the value onboarding problems, the planning requires more details on how it will be done. The key aspect of this challenge is VALUE, that is, providing not only a channel to attract large numbers of users, but on how to do the onboard, how to direct them to various types of information related to Catalyst. I recommend that proposers provide more detailed planning that addresses these aspects so that we can better understand how the proposal will address the challenge efficiently.
The proposal has a well laid out plan with key milestones identified. Scope, time, and cost are all estimated. Metrics for auditing success include #of users on the new app.
The proposal provides detailed information on budget and timeline breakdowns as well as lists KPIs to track progress. It satisfies the category challenge.
maybe. seems like just another pull owner looking for free money to further their firstly their business. at least they are not asking for much money

Clear and sufficient information has been provided. A detailed roadmap makes it easy to audit.

There is a clear funding detail, but are you sure the fund will cover the costs?

It is not entirely clear where the information on the app itsself will come from.

There is sufficient information to assess its feasibility but more clarity on the collaboration required to achieve the applications goal as well as who would manage the application or if its going to be replacing rhe current ideascale project catalyst or as a side tool. What educational content especifucwlly and what kind of services are going to be part of this expansion?

solution: A Mobile App to educate on Project Catalyst, manage tasks for roles being worked on. Members will be rewarded with Catalyst tokens.
experience: 20+ years in the Financial Industry running teams and developing applications for Top Tier Banks. 5 years building blockchain apps and APIs.
